category: Articles of Incorporation/Article 31 (Resignation and dismissal of officers)
contents: Article 31 (Resignation and dismissal of executives) ① If an executive other than the chairman resigns, he or she must submit a letter of resignation to the chairman or his acting representative. If the chairman resigns, he or she must submit a resignation letter to the secretariat. If an executive submits a letter of resignation, he or she is deemed to have resigned upon submission. ② When an executive of a member organization or a person representing an athletic organization, etc., becomes an executive of an athletics association, is deemed to have naturally resigned when he or she is dismissed or resigns from the relevant organization. Revised 2021. 7. 5.
